  • Matrix2D

Class Matrix2D

Represents an affine transformation matrix, and provides tools for constructing and concatenating matrices.

This matrix can be visualized as:

[ a  c  tx
  b  d  ty
  0  0  1  ]

Properties

a

a: number = 1
  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:18

Position (0, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:22

Position (0, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:26

Position (1, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:30

Position (1, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

tx

tx: number = 0
  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:34

Position (2, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

ty

ty: number = 0
  • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:38

Position (2, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

equals

  • equals(matrix: Matrix2D): boolean
    • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:366

    Checks whether two matrixes are equal. The result is true if and only if the argument is a Matrix2D object that has the same values.

    Parameters

    • matrix: Matrix2D

      the Object to compare with this Matrix2D object.

    Returns boolean

    true if the objects are equal; false otherwise.

rotate

  • rotate(angle: number): Matrix2D
    • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:265

    Applies a clockwise rotation transformation to the matrix.

    Parameters

    • angle: number

      The angle to rotate by, in degrees. To use a value in radians, multiply it by 180/Math.PI

    Returns Matrix2D

    The current instance. Useful for chaining method calls

scale

  • scale(x: number, y: number): Matrix2D
    • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:299

    Applies a scale transformation to the matrix.

    Parameters

    • x: number

      The amount to scale horizontally. E.G. a value of 2 will double the size in the X direction, and 0.5 will halve it

    • y: number

      The amount to scale vertically

    Returns Matrix2D

    The current instance. Useful for chaining method calls

skew

  • skew(skewX: number, skewY: number): Matrix2D
    • Defined in base/Matrix2D.ts:286

    Applies a skew transformation to the matrix.

    Parameters

    • skewX: number

      The amount to skew horizontally in degrees. To use a value in radians, multiply it by 180/Math.PI

    • skewY: number

      The amount to skew vertically in degrees

    Returns Matrix2D

    The current instance. Useful for chaining method calls
